intro: Dicrypta villosa, commonly known as the hairy dicrypta, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. It produces small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Dicrypta villosa is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks.
